page.title: 03Sunnyside Primary School
page.content: Sunnyside Primary School was built in Coulby Newham in 1978. It was the first purpose built primary school integrating children with{special {needs}into ordinary school. The school has children who are partially sighted, partially hearing, E.S.N. and physically handicapped who are taught in normal classes as much as possible. There is also an{adjustment unit}where children with behaviour problems can be withdrawn from other schools. The building is{open plan}and built around courtyards and has small quiet rooms for group work. There is a coffee bar as the school is also used as a {community centre.}Near to Sunnyside is Coulby Newham Secondary School. When a pupil reaches the age of 11 he or she moves to that school but children with special needs may stay on an extra year at Sunnyside.
